With an enormous array of flavors like blueberry muffin, apple pie, and cinnamon bun, figuring out which flavor to get is difficult as getting a sample of 42 flavors would be a faux pas. I opted for the apple pie on a sugar cone and came out happy with a creamy ice cream with cinnamon and chunks of pie crust and apples. It was a perfect treat while strolling around the neighborhood.

We've always had great pizza, salads, and gelato at Mercurio's. Tonight? Not so much. We were seated at an outdoor table, given menus, and forgotten. Twice I tried to get the attention of one of the waitstaff. Both looked right through me. After 15 minutes of waiting, I went inside and returned the menus. They clearly were not interested in my business.

I've been here twice so far. Once for the pizza, and once for the gelato. Both in the same night seemed like dairy overload.

The pizza was pretty flavorful, but I was very disappointed with how watery it was. Since I've only had it once, it could certainly be due to the particular ingredients that came on my pizza. The crust seemed properly cooked and everything - but there was just too much water on top.

I quite like that they use the hotter-than-hell-flash-cook method for cooking the pizzas. I much prefer the thin crust and nice charred taste that it provides compared to the thick crust baked wonderbread taste.

The gelato was all delicious. Nice selection of flavors.

The staff was very friendly as well. I'll definitely be back to see about getting a slightly drier pizza. Hopefully they can get bumped up a star or two if they deliver.

This review is based on the pizza.  I tried the Romana, and in my opinion it was not up to par.  The toppings weren't either flavorful enough or plentiful enough (either would work, and you CAN have one but not the other) to carry the overpowering taste of chewy bread that is the crust.  There was also a presence of a burned flavor over part of the pizza.  Mind you, the pizza was not burned - it actually looked well cooked, but this 'flavor of burned' flavor somehow came from some place and permeated the crust of this pizza.  Not the 'good burned' either, but rather the kind of bitter, acrid wet-wood-smoke taste.  I've eaten worse things, but I don't think I'll be back to Mercurio's for pizza.

The gelato looked good.

Service was friendly, and I don't knock the servers or wait staff for anything...  but to management:  One register, and shared with the gelato stand?  That's no good.  Also, I could tell there was an issue with organization.  Staff were good people, but there's something about the system in place which seems to cause unnecessary wait times, and some confusion.

If I factored in parking and trying to 'get there' on a Wednesday night, I'd take all the stars away, because while some people might like hanging out in that part of town, I found it to be a hassle.  I am NOT factoring that in to my rating (2 stars for the food...  taste vs. expectations, period, and for me it was as I mentioned sub par this night).  I had to take multiple turns and avoid or accommodate negligent pedestrians left and right, and finally parallel park, which I guess in the city just means 'park'.  When it comes to food, I would like to order food, go to pick it up, park, and do that.  Here, I had to search for parking, and it wasn't a pleasant experience.  I'll walk a couple of blocks, but this was ridiculous.  Compared to other places I've been to and done this in Pittsburgh, this ranks high on my 'most annoying to get to' list.

In short, if you want pizza, there has got to be a better way to get what will probably be better pizza.  That's what this review is about.  No hard feelings.  Thanks for showing me what you got, and if I ever come back it will be for ice cream (or gelato, and I'll be holding up the register for frustrated call in pizza orderers and dining room guests...)

I had the prosciutto pizza, my fiance had the calzone. Both were very good! The sauce tastes fresher and you can tell it's more authentic. Our food was hot and the gelato was delicious. If you want better service, it's probably better to sit inside, however. The waiter took our order and gave us our drinks and didn't return until after we finished eating. It would have been nice to have a refill before the check came but the food was still delicious!

One of the biggest problems with this place is the fact that they won't allow you to build your own pizza. You can only order the options on the menu and the pizzas are loaded with sauce and little cheese, plus the crust was burnt. The drink glasses were so small I had to keep asking for refills and our experience was not very enjoyable.

Great selection of ice cream--I'm a big fan of the black cherry and caramel latte.  Pizzas and salads are great--I always ask that they make my crust 'crisp' or else the make it to gooey and soggy for my liking.  Location is excellent and the staff nice.

Bianco pizza with proscuitto and a margarita pizza. I may have found the best pizza in Pittsburgh. From the salad with proscuitto and panini bread to the Bianco pizza to the death by chocolate gelato ... I am smitten. So many flavors that my mouth was literally watering for each bite. I didn't want it to end. Can't wait to come back.

Mercurio's is a small pizza and gelato joint in Walnut Street. It can get packed, but you can order to go if you're not up for the wait. Some of my favorite dishes are their perfectly seasoned House salad and the salsiccio pizza. They also have some delicious white pizzas for those who aren't a fan of/can't have red sauce. 

The gelato is a whole separate story over here. It's so hard to choose, but thankfully you can sample the flavors to make your decision easier (or harder, because they're all freaking delicious). Some of my favorites are the dulche de leche and the blueberry muffin.

Who doesn't love gelato? Honestly to me it's better than ice cream especially when it's coming from an establishment that really knows how to make it. Salty caramel is the one I really like. There's a nice selection of flavors to choose from.

My fiancé and I are Neopolitian pizza snobs. I simply love a super-thin-crust brick-oven pizza (with amazing cheese!). Mercurio's brought be back to the days when I studied abroad in Italy at the first bite! I've searched and found some favorite restaurants over the years, but I'm pretty sure this place tops them all. I've raved about it so much that I think my fiancé and I are going to plan a return trip to Pittsburgh (We live in Seattle!) just so he can try it! PS - order the buffalo mozzarella - It is better than I ever hoped to be able to find in the states! I just wish this pizza was available somewhere closer to home! Maybe the owners will consider a franchise?!

I love gelato!

Went here before heading to the airport and it was as good as usual.

I am particularly fond of their key lime gelato which is a great mix of sweet, sour, and tangy.  Other than that I found that the dulce de leche was a bit too sweet, but overall I really like gelato and this is a great place to get it.

I'm truly so thankful for Mercurio's in my new gluten free lifestyle. I honestly never thought I'd have good pizza again! THANK GOD for this fantastic gluten free pizza! 

Currently they only offer it Mon-Wed. I would hope that word would spread and they'd extend it to other days, but I assume it's just costly for them to make GF dough if it goes unused every day. But the dough... That's the main issue with GF pizza. Mercurio's pizza crust tasted exactly like regular dough. I couldn't tell the difference, I swear to you!

I never thought I could get my fave del ra pizza again. Again, thank god I could! I'm so excited to come back when I have a hankering for pizza. I only wish they were closer to home. But it's worth it to make the extra trip!

Neopolitan pizza is not like other pizza, so Mercurio's food will not suit everyone.  That being said, the pizza tastes exactly as Neopolitan ought to--chewy in the middle and browned /crispy on the crust.  It's light on the cheese and toppings, so it tastes much healthier than other pizza.  

I've had the Fungi, Primavera, Prosciutto, and Regina(?)/Bufalo mozzarella pizzas, and my clear favorite is the Regina/Bufalo mozzarella pizza.  Given how delicate and flavorful the Bufalo is, I agree with another reviewer that it would be nice if they allowed you to switch the house-made mozzarella with the Bufalo on other pizzas.  The simplicity--while usually delightful--can occasionally translate into blandness; for that reason, I like Il Pizzaiolo slightly more-- it has more options. Another thing that makes Mercurio's feel authentically Italian is the reasonably priced and tasty glasses of house wine.  

I have to mention the Caprese and Prosciutto Paninis-- these are so big, filling, and flavorful, with gooey mozzarella and balsamic vinegar!  They come with a side salad or soup, so this is almost the better option if you're really hungry and wanting some melty comfort food. 

Given that the restuarant has a popular gelato shop right in the middle of it, it's more of a lunch or a casual dinner place--don't go expecting an intimate, romantic setting.  If the hubbub bothers you, you can always wait a few minutes extra/ request a table in the back section away from the gelato line.  And Yeah; Dulce de Leche gelato is sooo delicious.  

The more I have Mercurio's pizzas, the more I crave them.  I'm definitely trying the Pizza del Re next time.

Took the family out for dinner last weekend and had a great time! We love this place... We've been here many times and consistency is the keyword here. The food is always good and the service is always friendly and the wait is never long.

My Italian friends maintain this place has the best pizza in Pittsburgh. Their crust is definitely on the softer side, so if you like a crispy pizza you may be disappointed, but it's full of flavor and topped with delicious sauce and cheese!

I love smoked anything, so my favorite is the Provola (basically a margherita  with smoked mozzarella). I have found I prefer not to order their pizzas with toppings: the first time I came here I had the Contadina, which I felt came with pitifully few pieces of eggplant. But if you stick with their simpler pizzas you can't go wrong

As for the gelato, I love how they have creative flavors, but the gelato doesn't quite have the density and depth of flavor that you find in the best gelato places. I will admit I have extremely high standards when it comes to ice cream, so perhaps I am being overly picky, especially considering how hard it is to find gelato at all in Pittsburgh!

Someone recommended Mercurio's to me yesterday and so I came in for dinner. The pizza is great! If you like brick oven pizza, you will enjoy this place. At the recommendation of our waiter, we ordered the Pizza Del Re, and also ordered the Primavera at our own volition. The Primavera was pretty good, but the Pizza Del Re was out of this world. All of the ingredients were great, but I think it was the truffle spread that put this over the top.

These pizzas can be a little tricky to eat without losing all of the toppings. We tried knife-and-fork plus the usually pizza-eating techniques, but found that the best way to eat it without making a mess is to fold the piece in half (so you are essentially creating another pie-shaped piece that is half the size). This keeps all of your toppings on and lets the "juice" seep out the back.

I tend to go to an unnamed (3-star worthy) frozen yogurt place just down the street when my sweet -tooth kicks in, but this will definitely be my new go-to. I tried the caramel latte and the pistachio, and if you are sitting down for dinner, your waiter/waitress can serve it for you so you avoid the line. 

I want to try to Salami pizza next and there are a few more gelato flavors that I was tempted by, so I'm sure I will be back soon.

Perfect amount of sauce, perfect amount of cheese, delicious crust and great toppings... Then there's the gelato. Great flavor a and great selection. 
Officially my favorite place for pie.

In every scoop of Mercurios Gelato there are over 13+ years of research, study, testing, obsession and love in their dozens of freshly made daily offerings.  Mrs. Mercurio and her husband took endless culinary workshops and university courses studying every aspect of ice cream and gelato production and you can experience the fruits of their labor in every taste.  They recently added pizza to their offerings.

The Mercurio's son trained at an authentic Sicilian pizza shop and they had an italian pizza oven imported to give an authentic product.   While many rave about the pizza at piccolo forno in lawrenceville, I found Mercurios to be much more authentic (and delicious) compared to the pizza I had in Italy.  The pizza dough is paper thin and savory (almost like crepes) the toppings are all fresh, generously administered and the crust is perfectly crispy.

The raw brick walls and black and white photos of italy complement the atmosphere and the staff were all extremely friendly and enthusiastic.  I'm not normally a huge Gelato or Pizza fan, but Mercurio's does not offer normal gelato or pizza.  They are the finest example of both I've tasted in Pittsburgh, I look forward to many more happy meals and desserts here, Mercurios has made me a believer!

Raspberry & Truffles...yes please!  Mercurio's definitely ranks as the top gelato shop in Pittsburgh.  They have tons of flavors, and each and everyone is delicious.  I also appreciate that you pay by weight, and the prices are reasonable.  They let you sample unlimited flavors until you decide, def a nice perk.  I haven't had a chance to try their pizza yet, I hoping it's just as good as their gelato.
Yummy too many to chose from so I had two key lime sorbet and mango coconut sorbetto yumm

Been here many times and the food is great, but 9 times out of 10 it takes excessively long - even when ordering takeout. Considering the type of food they serve and the atmosphere here this is frustrating most of the time.
Great pizza if you dig real pizza! Just like Europe! Big ups!

OMG, 42 gelato flavors!! Every other gelato place I know max out at about 12 flavors, haha. If I was living in Pittsburgh about now, I would so go on Mercurio's Gelato Journey and try a different flavor every time I was there... and that's not just because I'm trying to escape the hot and humid Pitt summer. 

Fiancee and I each got a medium: hazelnut and peanut butter... at under a dollar per ounce. Very good gelato, and open until quite late. I'm under the impression that they're open as long as Girasole downstairs is. (Italian ice cream after an Italian dinner, anybody?) Quite awesome.

I'll definitely be back. It calls for at least another 41 visits from me.

A scoop of cookies and cream with a scoop of confetti hit the spot on a 75 degree summer evening!  Oh man was it good.  I like it when my ice cream actually tastes like something other than opaque ice, and this did for sure!  I wasn't quite sure what the confetti was going to be flavored like when I ordered it, thinking maybe cake batter but it looked good so I got it anyway, and after about 3 bites I could tell it was flavored like that confetti cake mix (or is that stuff flavored after something even else?)!   Flavor!  I want to go back a million more times to try them all!

Small pizza place on Walnut. I used yelp's join the line feature and we didn't have to wait in the line on a Saturday night. Great start....but I recommend requesting for a door that is not close to the front door especially on cold weather days. 

Our waiter was helpful in explaining the items on the menu. The wait time for food was not long, maybe around 10 minutes for each of the items we ordered. 

We ordered bruschetta for starters and pizza Roberto 
The crust was softer and bigger than the typical crostini used for bruschetta. I recommend trying this. Pizza is good quantity for 2 people consisting of 4 big slices. It is a thin crust pizza.  Cheese is the center of attraction for the pizza Roberto. The main flavors were basil and grape vine tomatoes. We ordered this to try the Barretta cheese. The crust was soft, fresh and airy. I never had a soft crust like this one. 

They offer a aariety of gelato flavors. I got the tiramisu and vanilla. Everything was great except for the fact that they gave 75% vanilla and 25% of tiramisu instead of half and half. That was disappointing since I was expecting equal quantities of both. 

I recommend this place if you are looking for some fresh flavorful pizza and of course their famous gelato is worth the visit.
